meanings.definition: In a way that is worthy of attention or notice.
meanings.sent1: She performed notably well in the school play.
meanings.sent2: The singer notably hit all the high notes during the performance.
meanings.sent3: His notably loud sneeze startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The sun notably brightened the entire garden.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's notably clear explanation helped the students understand the concept easily.

meanings.sent1: The dessert was notably delicious at the party.
meanings.sent2: He was notably excited to receive the award.
meanings.sent3: The cat was notably lazy, even for a cat.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak was notably difficult to climb.
meanings.sent5: The new employee was notably quick to learn the company's procedures.
